column1: #Text=—On Saturday last, before the Mayor, Richard Saunders was charged with embezzling £1 9s. 6d. from the Great Western Railway Company.
#Text=Prisoner was in the employ of the company, and witnesses were called to prove that be had received the money from Mr.
#Text=Rowe, iron founder, of Yeovil, and had not accounted for it.
#Text=He was remanded for further evidence as to other charges.
#Text=—A night or two since a gentleman who was either mad or elevated hired a fly at the Mermaid Hotel, and requested to be driven to a neighbouring town.
#Text=The driver, Lolock, noticed on the way that his face was playing some strange antics, and attributed it to indulging too freely in strong drink.

#Text=Temp. midnight, and near to the destination of the stranger, he suddenly popped his head outside the window of the fly, declared he was a Fenian, and pointed a pistol at the head of the unoffending driver, declaring that he would shoot him if he did not instantly stop.
#Text=Trembling in every Umb, Lolock alighted, and requested the selfdubbed Fenian to alight.
#Text=The man with the pistol did so, Lolock jumped on the box, and drove back to Yeovil at full speed, leaving his astonished fare a few miles from home in the middle of the road.
#Text=He had previously paid for the journey ; but Lolock did not stop to receive the usual gratuity.
